div.class: inner col col17 first last id5f7d5199-420c-4255-a3f4-8fb8e13fd661

div.p: There are no published events in current month.

a.aria-label: Calendar View All

h4.a: Hanover survey seeks residentsâ€™ input on services, quality of life

div.div: Hanover just launched a community survey designed to gather feedback on government services and overall quality of life in the area. By participating, residents can share what matters most to them and offer insight into what they think can be improved. Read on...

h4.a: Hanover Supervisors appoint new Mechanicsville School Board representative

div.div: Hanover Countyâ€™s Board of Supervisors unanimously appointed Ryan Martin to the School Board following the recommendation of Mechanicsville Supervisor Ryan M. Hudson. Read on...

h4.a: Hanover County invites residents to join 9/11 Day of Service

div.div: Hanover residents are invited to join County employees and more than 30 million people across the nation in giving back to their communities during the 9/11 National Day of Service. Read on...

h4.a: Hanover County to launch inaugural Citizens Academy

div.div: Hanover County residents are invited to get an inside look at how their local government works by participating in the inaugural Engage Hanover Citizens Academy (EHCA). Read on...

h4.a: Hanover CSB seeks nominations for Jean C. Harris Award for Excellence

div.div: Hanover CSB is accepting nominations for the Jean C. Harris Award for Excellence. This annual award recognizes individuals, families or organizations that have made outstanding contributions in mental health, substance use and developmental disabilities. Read on...

h4.a: At-risk Hanover residents urged to register for emergency assistance

div.div: Hanover County Department of Social Services is encouraging at-risk residents to register now for evacuation assistance and specialized support during emergencies such as power outages, flooding or ice storms. Read on...

h4.a: Hanover County seeks nominees to replace departing School Board member

div.div: The Board of Supervisors is seeking nominations for the Mechanicsville District School Board seat after School Board member John E. Redd Jr. announced plans to resign. Redd plans to move outside the district and will no longer be eligible to serve. Read on...

h4.a: Board approves data center complex near Ashland

div.div: The Hanover County Board of Supervisors voted on Wednesday night to approve the development of a 1,200-acre data center technology park north of the Town of Ashland. The Planning Commission unanimously recommended approval of the project in January. Read on...

h4.a: GRTC launches free on-demand transit service in Ashland

div.div: Excitement filled the air outside Ashland Town Hall on Monday morning during the launch of a free on-demand public transit service in the Ashland area â€“ a game changer for residents who donâ€™t drive or lack their own transportation. Read on...
